title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children (Rome)
Interview Descriptions: Il colloquio per la posizione include una serie di prove scritte e un'intervista orale, mirate a valutare le competenze tecniche e la compatibilità con l'organizzazione. Questo processo di selezione è fondamentale per identificare il candidato ideale.
Interview Questions: come la tua esperienza di lavoro attuale puo' essere utile in questo incarico?

title: Philanthropy Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The questions were mostly scenario based questions but they sent them before the interview which was very helpful as you were able to prepare. The interviewers were friendly and gave helpful feedback
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you had to influence a cold prospect

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Save the Children (Berlin) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: They were so nice and friendly without any stress. The company's atmosphere was friendly, and I felt like I was talking with my friends during the interview. Even the team leader was a nice guy.
Interview Questions: I am still waiting for their answer.

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Save the Children (Cairo, Cairo Governorate)
Interview Descriptions: 1 hour of question related to technical and team work and it’s not easy to get shortlisted until you have someone from inside and the panel consists of three members and they measure a lot of things
Interview Questions: What is the team member characteristics that you can’t deal with

title: Advocacy Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: I had four rounds of interviews for the Advocacy Advisor position: a writing assessment with 6 questions, a 1:1 interview with the position's supervisor, a panel interview with the advocacy team, and a 1:1 interview with the department head.
Interview Questions: Questions asked during the writing assessment: 1) What is most important to you in the next step of your career? Why do you feel that this position is the right step for you? 2) What is your experience working on political or advocacy campaigns. 3) Describe your experience in strategic planning. What steps did you take during planning? Tell us about the presentation of the proposal. 4) Please share an example where you have influenced stakeholders, either internally or externally. What steps did you take and what was the result 5) Tell us about an accomplishment you’re proud of. What did you learn 6) What experience do you have with working with Board of Directors? What did you enjoy the most and what challenges did you face in the work? Questions asked during interviews: 1) Based on the job description, what are your strengths that are detailed in the JD? 2) What skills have you developed that would make you successful in this role? 3) How do you approach organizing deadlines and projects with colleagues? 4) Think of a time where you affected change where you had some amount of influence. What happened? 5) Give an example of of when you managed conflict at a senior level: what was the situation, what was my role, what actions were taken, and what was end result? 6) Describe your experience working with others that have different backgrounds than your own 7) What do you expect to be the biggest challenges in this role? 8)

title: stage comunicazione Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children (Rome)
Interview Descriptions: 2 colloqui, uno conoscitivo e uno tecnico in cui era richiesto di mostrare la propria personalità e le proprie abilità professionali. Colloquio stimolante e esperienza assolutamente positiva. Le responsabili mettono a proprio agio il candidato
Interview Questions: Domande per approfondire percorso di studio e percorso professionale

title: Contractor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was clear and straightforward. It was clear considering the ever shifting, complexity of needs for a project. There wasn’t much of a wait time between communication channels and this was distinct against other organizations navigating bureaucracy. The staff was kind and professional and this was also notable.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background. What would previous organizations say about you.

title: Shop Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very natural and the shop manager taught all the in-store tasks through two hours. At the same time getting your hands on the execution。Culling clothes, pricing, cashiering and window display
Interview Questions: Why did you come to volunteer?

title: External Collaborator-Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (Waikabubak) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was okay. they ask you more about you experience in handling children and communities, and how you handle a fast paced environment work. i got the offer 3 days after the interview
Interview Questions: What is you experience in handling children and communities.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Save the Children in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: First off there was a written test conducted virtually, if you were successful you were invited for a face-to-face interview at their offices. If you are successful they will request three references from you.
Interview Questions: Would you rather finish a task fast or do the task efficiently

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR for an initial screening call. After the initial screening call I was invited to a 1 hour panel interview with my perspective supervisors. the Panel interview was divided into categories from technical questions, to people management questions.
Interview Questions: Scenario based questions on how I would manage programing issues.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: Took about a little over a month to respond to an interview. Overall, very easy-going interview process; asked me basic questions. It took around 20-30 minutes and got an offer a week after the interview.
Interview Questions: Why were you interested in this position? What experiences do you have that make you a good fit for this internship?

title: HR Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children (Ḩawwārah, Amman Governorate)
Interview Descriptions: The interview usually has 2-3 pannels asking general HR questions and one of them is about the organization's policy, which they already send by email before the interview. in addition, they look to your English skills to be good and you can explain your ideas clearly.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself. What is your management style? Did you read our policies and what did you understand?

title: Lead Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: The first step was an email with a few detailed questions about you and your expectations for salary. I thought they were great questions to start and set the tone for both sides.
Interview Questions: They asked for specific examples of my experience using Microsoft Excel.

title: Program Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Save the Children in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Poor. I was contacted over a month after I submitted my application to answer some supplementary questions. In that email I was told that they were "fast-tracking" the hiring for this position, and needed the responses back in 48 hours. I returned the answers, but wasn't contacted again for several weeks. They finally responded, inviting me for an interview. The HR person said the hiring manager would contact me within the next couple days to set up an appointment. Two weeks later, I contacted them again to inquire about the interview. When we finally scheduled the interview, they were ten minutes late to start. The interview questions were merely the exact same questions as the written questions. The entire process was quite unprofessional, and I'm disappointed that I didn't read the reviews about the company sooner.
Interview Questions: Tell us how you would safeguard employees. Tell us how you would safeguard children.

title: Senior Technical Advisor Child Health and Nutrition Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: Fair. The interview lasted for an hour, and I needed to finish another written test prior to the interview. At least one question in the interview and the written test were about their organizational policies concerning children's safety.
Interview Questions: Organizational policies concerning children's safety, which they send you to read prior to the interview.

title: Managing Director, Monitoring and Evaluation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Save the Children (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Started with two rounds of essay questions about experience, leadership style, salary history, communications approach, and navigating politics. Then an interview with the VP followed by a panel interview with the supervisor and colleagues from different teams. I was offered the position but got a lot of pushback when I requested to give my employer a months notice, which seems standard at this level of leadership. Ultimately, I got major red flags about the leadership style and work culture.
Interview Questions: Technical skill set. Content expertise. Leadership and management style. Experience with conflict resolution/problem solving. Anticipated challenges.

title: Analytics Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by someone junior to the role who only actually asked 2 questions but spoke a lot and meant really couldn’t show of skills or suitability for the job. Found out afterwards has happened with all 10+ candidates put forward so far so feels like process isn’t working
Interview Questions: Only 2 asked in total 30m interview

title: Program Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Save the Children (Shanghai, Shanghai) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions:
send cover letter and cv
a phone call to make an appointment for an interview
a 25 minutes interview
The HR team is nice and the process is efficient.A very good experience.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
Why our organization?
Share some relevant experiences.

title: Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (Shanghai, Shanghai) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview panels were made up of 3 project staff and a HR staff. Basically a competency-based interview, ask you to use example to elaborate some of your skills and experience. Salary for national staff is low.
Interview Questions: Q: planning and organization skills Q: stakeholder communications Q: donor communications Q: M&E skills

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: Process was ok.  Office was small.  Not really convenient to get to.  Not too far from the subway. Didn't think room for growth. If you like to work in a small office environment, with same faces, this could work for you.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Save the Children?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: The first phone screen took about 15 minutes and they asked me general questions about my experience in Community Development and about my past experience. This was conducted by someone outside the "team" they were hiring. Then, I was sent a list of questions to answer in short paragraph form and resubmitted. Then, I had a second interview with one person on the actual team where they asked more technical questions about community development work and the actual subject area I would be working in.
Interview Questions: Please share your experience with cultivating partnerships and building relationships with stakeholders.

title: Senior Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions:
I had 2 rounds of interviews. The first round was with the recruiter for the role and a colleague.  The second was with 2 more senior employees. 

The interviewers asked typical questions, including behavioral questions specifically related to the job description for the role.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Save the Children?

title: Lead Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, I received an email several weeks later from an HR representative asking me to answer several (5-10) background questions. After submitting responses to those questions, I was then contacted by someone from the hiring team to schedule an interview over Zoom.
Interview Questions: Q: What is one aspect of the job that you feel would come naturally, and one aspect of the job that would require some adjustment?

title: Snr Health Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: First is the written interview where a set of carefully chosen test questions (technical) are administered and to be resubmitted back within 2 hours. This is followed by a panel interview comprising the hiring manager, technical advisor, HR Manager and other departmental heads. The next level is the interview with the head of mission.
Interview Questions: What is child Safeguarding, and how do you ensure it?

title: Shop Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: I found the  interview process to be straight forward and relaxed. I was asked some questions about availability and to expand on some of the information I had put in my written application.
Interview Questions: When are you available to volunteer?

title: Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: Before being asked to interview, I answered 4 in detail questions related to the position over email, after submitting my cover letter and resume. During the interview, they asked technical questions about the position, no "general" interview questions. The interviewers were nice but professional.
Interview Questions: What are your experiences in advocacy?

title: Senior Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Save the Children (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
The overall interview process went well and everyone I have interviewed with from HR to the team I was going to join was great. First step was basic screening questions with HR, and then second step was interwiew with the hiring manager for about 45 minutes. Afterwards , an hour interview with the panel of three people that also went well.
What I absolutely hated is the fact that they asked about the minimum salary that I wanted during the screening questions, and then after the  multiple interviews, they make an offer lower than my minimum request ....and that was the best they could do. Even for such a great company, I am not willing to settle for less than what I believe is a fair rate.  Let's be respectful of one another's time and start acting like mature people.
Interview Questions: What is your motivation to work with Save The Children?

title: Superviseur HSE Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: Le jury était très patient et vraiment à l'écoute. Il ont posé des questions des questions pertinentes et savait aussi faire les relances . Il n'hésite pas à motiver le candidat qui se sent pas à la hauteur
Interview Questions: Quel sera votre apport pour la structure

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for this position was fairly standard.  I had an initial email from HR with screening questions that I needed to answer, followed by a panel interview with 4 staff members.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Child Protection Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: Easy to follow, with clear steps, friendly environment and clear objectives. The interviewers seemed particularly interested in verifying knowledge of safeguarding policies from the candidate. This was a major priority for the role
Interview Questions: Knowledge of safeguarding policies was inportant

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Save the Children in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was asked to do a Zoom Interview with HR. It was quick and relatively painless but the interviewer seemed very inexperienced  which makes it a little awkward. Questions were so broad and vague that it was hard to know what they were getting at - like, “Tell me how you build partnerships.” At the end, I asked about the rest of the process and she assured me I’d hear from her within a week. One month and two follow-up emails later and I’ve still not heard from them again. If you have time to interview someone for 30 minutes, you have time to send them a quick email about the status of their candidacy. Disappointing and unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Tell me how you build partnerships.

title: Supply Chain Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: They ask you for an exam after receiving the application. based on the exam, they contact you for interview. based on that they decide whether the applicant is the right fit.
Interview Questions: How could you navigate the  differences shattering the country?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: I applied online the the jobs portal and within a week or so was invited for an interview  by phone with two people in the department.  I answered questions about my background, my studies, and my interests.  I heard back a couple days later that I got the position.
Interview Questions: Please tell us about yourself.

title: Influencer and PR Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Save the Children (New York, NY) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and a recruiter reached out. She wanted me to answer a few job-related questions and reached back out to let me know someone on staff wanted to interview me. It was a fairly easy interview. The staffer let me know there had been a lot of recent turnover and she was in the process of constructing a new team. She said she was still interviewing other candidates at the time. It's been about 2 weeks and I haven't heard back from the organization at all.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here?

How does your experience apply?

title: Oficial de salud Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: Agradable , puntual, una entrevista de manera horizontal con 3 reclutadores, muy amables, en tiempos adecuados , la entrevista fue virtual duro aproximadamente 30 minutos en un marco de preguntas de 3 minutos por respuesta, dividido entre 3 reclutadores que realizaban preguntas con respecto a tu experiencia laboral, desempeño en momentos complicados , psicologicos etc.
Interview Questions: Experiencia laboral y como enfrentar los retos

title: Marketing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very polite and accessible. She explained well the job, posed relevant questions for the position, and made me fell comfortable. The interview was online and it took about 40 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position and how it relates to your past professional experiences.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: applied via online and online interview with 4 panelists, regional manager, director, Health TA and HR . Duration 1 hour question and answer related to how to manage program and maintain communication with stakeholder
Interview Questions: program management , technical aspect related to program, multitasking skill

title: Digital Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: It was very smooth and easy going  , they asked a lot of questions about the Save the children's vision and other skill based questions. Overall it was a good experience  the both interviews were very nice and knowledgeable.
Interview Questions: When is a time you resolved an issues in you last employment.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: the interview was online they asked about my expectations and motivation for the internship. then they explained to me what was their expectations.  it was not too long like 15 minutes
Interview Questions: why did you choose this organization

title: Child Protection Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (Sarajevo)
Interview Descriptions: 20 minute online process, pretty simple. Education background, work experience and motivation is important. Easy to prepare for, just prepare your PC and learn about your specific location of work ( country, situation)
Interview Questions: Say something about your motivation.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: 1 hour meeting with different technical questions appropriate to the job, nothing too complicated or creative, but the responses had to be specific and elaborate. About 15 to 20 questions.
Interview Questions: What are the common challenges of [specific process] for [specific target group]

title: SBCC Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions:
One  round written exam remotely with in the given fixed time 
One  round interview for more than an hour 
One  round written exam remotely with in the given fixed time 
One  round interview for more than an hour
Interview Questions: What SBCC models used for WaSH services?

title: Child Protection Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Save the Children in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Resume selection and then online panel interview with two program officers and the HR. Start with self-introduction and then Q&A, what questions do I want to ask. A bit casual chat in the end.
Interview Questions: Thank god no "tell me about a time when you..." type of storytelling questions. The interview is more about the motivation, expectation and actual knowledge of the program, as well as some organizing skill questions.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children (Nairobi) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: the interview was great though I was not chosen and I believe I would have been chosen if I had prepared well. the interviewers were friendly and made me at ease
Interview Questions: can you tell us about yourself

title: Praktikum Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: small talk first and then they started to ask question based on my CV and later my further plan about master. They were very nice and kind. It was a good interview
Interview Questions: Problem solving, Hobbys, What i will study in master.

title: Scrum Master Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: telephone screening to talk about general role and experience, and then invired to a second interview via  video call with hiring manager and lead agile coach and a scrum master, they asked 3-4 questions each.
Interview Questions: describe a time you overcome a difficult situation.

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Save the Children (New Delhi) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was lengthy and took a long time to close.  There were several days where there would be no response even after follow ups.
The HR personnel was not supportive enough to enable a smooth transition.
Interview Questions: Round one comprised of basic introductory questions. Round two was more organisation specific and round three was primarily on compensation negotiation

title: Awards Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: I firstly sent my CV and Cover letter on their platform, then I have been pre-selected and invited to Videocall interview with a panel of three representatives.  After two weeks I have been contacted and offered the position.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were technical. However, I was given the time to present myself and express my motivation.

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (London, England) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: First  stage was a pre call, and if successfully,  second stage had 10 a minute presentation followed by competency based questions from the group. This was done over teams online.
Interview Questions: How to keep team motivated? How to  support multiple teams with limited resources

title: Grants Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: The interview came through quickly, but the actually interview was somewhat disjointed. It seems like the people interviewing me were concerned that I was overqualified and focused on that, rather than asking why I was interested in the position and what I had to offer.
Interview Questions: What didn't you like about your last job?

title: MEAL Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions:
Panel interview with three staff members. It lasted approximately 40 minutes. Pleasant atmosphere. They try to make you feel comfortable. Before the interview, I had a written test.
After the interview, it took them just one day to give me the results.
Interview Questions: They asked several job-related questions, such as "Describe how would you conduct internal evaluation", several questions about the experience.

title: Senior Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: They were fast to respond and very attentive. The team I interviewed with seemed to be very interested and were able to explain the question thoroughly. I think it went smoothly.
Interview Questions: What kind of databases have you worked with?

title: Award Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process, it took more than 2 months to complete it. First you take a written test, afterwards and interview with three staff members, and finally post interviews checks.
Interview Questions: What would I thought about save guarding childhood  policy?

title: Medical Doctor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children (Mogadishu) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: After a written exam, save the child send an email 3 weeks later requesting an interview. The interview was through skype audio, three people from the organization interviewed me. It took 30 min maximum for the interview to finish.
Interview Questions:
Most of the questions was about the mandate of the organization, and how they deliver services to the people in need.
Also they asked about the child protection and safeguarding.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children (Nairobi) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: 3 days notice to the interview, little or no time for preparation. The process was online where it was more like an exam, timed to be completed in under 2 hours
Interview Questions: This was a Written interview

title: Clinical Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Five Interviewer, asked questions on practical situation basis, asked questions on team work, work ethics, sexual harrasement and many more. It was quite standard and good.  They gave me many situational doubts, happening, something to do and asked me to solve the problem on my own, how to handle those situation. I thing it was really good one to have interview in that way. they also asked me some statistics related to my job position and responsibility.
Interview Questions: Which was asked on sexual harrasement

title: Project Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children (China, ME) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
A phone call to check your time several days later

1.1-h written test;
2.1-h 4vs1 interview

2 weeks later, the officer telephoened me to inform me about the result.s

Guess there is only 1-round interview because it's an entry level post. Overall speaking,
Interview Questions: Interview, both in English and Chinese: self-introduction, understanding on the post, local policy, behavioural questions about team work and government relationship

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Phone call with a recruiter followed by a zoom interview with the person who would be my direct boss. Sadly did not proceed after that. Next step would be a panel zoom interview
Interview Questions: Looking at the job posting, what is something you would knot be able to do on the first day?

title: Facilities Protection Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children (Athens, Athens, Attica)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy and didn’t take long. Safeguarding questions and case studies and analysis.    It lasted around 30 minutes and the panel was two people. You might have a small interview with hr afterwards.
Interview Questions: How would you react if one of your team members was really close to one of the children?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: It was heart wrenching. I waited for over 3 hours. HR acted like they were not interested in me. they looked very distracted the whole time of the interview. They made me feel worthless. I proved them wrong though. HR very knefficient
Interview Questions: What are project management tools?

title: Research and Experimentation Specialist (CUBIC) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children (Singapore) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process included: 1) an application, 2) a written test of case study questions, 3) an interview that entailed creating/presenting a presentation, behavioral questions, and standard interview questions. 
I went through the entire process, but was unfortunately not offered a position. I would have rated my overall experience as neutral, however,  after the interview process, I was frustrated that they did not respond to my request for feedback after. Of course, they do not owe me this. That said, given the amount of time applicants had to invest into the process (the written test, creating a presentation, interviews, etc),  it would have been more professional to provide feedback to all the candidates.
Interview Questions: - Create a presentation on one of your previous data collection projects (with instructions) to be presented during the interview

title: Volontario Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (Ro) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Il colloquio è stato effettuato online insieme ad altri candidati. A ciascun candidato è stato richiesto di parlare di se e delle proprie esperienze. Dopo qualche settimana ho ricevuto una chiamata per iniziare la mia esperienza di volontariato.
Interview Questions: Parlami un po' di te.

title: Knowledge Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: process was relatively simple . there was a short written test and two interviews - one with the team and one with the director.  style was conversational and questions were conventional questions on strength, weakness, and scenarios
Interview Questions: What are you strengths and weakness

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Save the Children (Sarajevo)
Interview Descriptions: During the interview the atmosphere was nice and relaxed, 3 panel members, cca 35min long interview, starting with opening questions (motivation, previous experience) and than  continue with competency based questions.. usually around 4 or 5 questions. Child Safeguarding is always must ask question
Interview Questions: Explain previous experiences, motivation, questions regarding Child Protection (case studies or have will you approach the issues), Child Safeguarding is always asked...

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children (Beirut) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy It was online and 2 people were in the panel. Introduce yourself What is a Pdm or post distribution monitoring What would you do if a beneficiary refuses to answer
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself What is a Pdm What would you do if a beneficiary refuses to answer

title: Promoter In Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Save the Children (Palermo) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: A causa covid il colloquio è avvenuto via whatsapp,mi sono presentato parlando un po' della mia vita le mie passioni e dei miei lavori precedenti.persone davvero competente e appassionate del loro lavoro.
Interview Questions: Per quale motivo vorresti lavorare per gli enti umanitari.

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Save the Children (Washington, DC) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The main interview included mostly standard questions as well as a couple on child safeguarding (even if the job doesn't involve direct interaction with children). There was a panel of 3 interviewers who took turns asking questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you've worked in a stressful environment. How did you manage?

title: Associate Director, Partnerships Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children (Washington, DC) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process took a very long time. I felt those conducting the interview were not always prepped in advance of the interview. The team was uncertain on the new role.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best fit for this role?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children (Toronto, ON)

Interview Questions: Tell us about your relevant experience ?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions:
There were 3 rounds of interviews:

1. A 15-20 minute basic phone screening interview with HR recruiter to obtain the basic information

2. A panel interview with team manager and team members to discuss the specific roles and skills, and how my experience would be relevant

3. A panel interview with team manager and department head to discuss overall contribution to department and team through role

The interviews were extremely educational and informative. They consisted of a dialog / discussion of  the position, its fit with other roles, and contribution to the mission and department.  

Three round of interviews were intense for the Coordinator level position. However, the departmental work and team is also top level and intense, so it was made sense.

The interviewers were very helpful, explained / educated and taught me through the interview process, and they were kind putting me at easy. They also made sure that I had an accurate grasp and understanding of the role. It was fascinating and mind opening, and truly gave me an accurate glimpse of what it would be like working in the organization in this particular department. I was given an opportunity to also ask questions and make comments.
Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in this position?
What skills / experience make you a good fit for this position?
What is your understanding of what you'd be doing in this job?
What experience do you have with .... [specific task from job description]
How familiar are you with [specific program used for the position]
How do you work in a diverse workplace?
How do you handle it if a coworker or someone around you may not be following the rules? 
What would you do in the case of ... [insert program specific situation here]
How do you go about keeping children safe?
Do you have any questions for us? [make sure to have 3-4 good questions lined up for interviewers]

title: Programme Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions:
The process starts with a written assessment and then, if selected, you move on to an interview. 
The person from HR at Save the Children UK was extremely disorganized, they had some technical issues and instead of apologizing and rescheduling, she let the candidates await for a written test that never came. Later, she was very inflexible about possible dates for rescheduling it. However, what is truly demotivating is that, after I did the written assessment, I received no response from HR. They also didn't respond to my emails inquiring about the results. They did the same to a colleague who was going through the same process. 

An HR Department that ghosts candidates after making them do a written assessment and/or interview is thoroughly unprofessional.  It speaks quite badly about the organization as a whole.
Interview Questions: The assessment lasted 45 minutes and it had two questions. The first was to read through a request for funding, fill in a questionnaire, and determine whether you would provide funding. The question asked how I would deal with a committee member that was not acting impartially.

title: Desk Officer/Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Save the Children (Remote, OR) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was conducted remotely due to field location. The interviewers internet wouldn't support a group call. We had spent 30 minutes trying to get connected and ultimately agreed that I would arrange a teleconference call.
Interview Questions:
When the interview began, I sensed immediately that the interviewers were in a rush. This was confirmed by them saying things like 'keep your answers brief'. At one point the interviews cut me off mid-answer. I found this very off-putting. It was clear that they were rushing through the questions. Also, the connection dropped out several times mid-answer which meant I had to re-dial and begin the answer again. It was supremely frustrating and disruptive. I am sure it impacted my overall performance. 

The questions asked were highly technical (not competency based) and in my view not very relevant or helpful in assessing my ability to perform in the role.  An example was asking for my opinion on the current problems in that technical area - very general, probably more suited to a high-level senior manager type role (someone who would, for example, be directing strategy and so on).

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Save the Children (London, England) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I undertook two interviews for two different administrative positions at Save the Children. I was given very little notice to prepare (2 days), and both times had to complete pre-interview tests (prioritising and spreadsheet comprehension based.)

While the interviewers were generally polite during both interviews, they came across very snooty. This is a problem in the international development sector anyhow. Yes, you work to 'save children', but have a bit of humility please! 
The office is beautiful, but the small room in which they my interviews meant I could see everything impolite which was getting written about me, which is very off-putting!

But the worst part for me is that after both interviews, none of them contacted me with the result. I've clearly been declined, but please recognize the massive effort and emotional-toll on the job seeker that has decided to approach you. They have, for however long, taken rejection after rejection, and have probably worked very hard just to prepare for this interview. It takes very little time to copy and paste a rejection to me and the 6 or 7 other people you reject at interview stage. In fact I'd consider it basic politeness.

I knew after walking out of there that I wouldn't fit in anyhow, because I want to help the needy too, but I don't need to look down my nose at other people in the process.
Interview Questions:
* How do you prioritise between urgent and important
* How do you deal with stress
* Have you handled big budgets

title: Logistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children (Dakar) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: generally before going through an interview you pass by a previous written test. Generally to answer this test you are given 1 or ½ hour to answer. If you have the change to pass this test, you get the interview which last about 20 min.
Interview Questions:
I applied few times to STC jobs, but every time I had very bad experiences when the interviewers were speaking from the fields.
First of all, note that before going through an interview you pass by a previous written test. Generally to answer this test you are given 1 or ½ hour to answer. Questions are very badly formulated, without any sense in respect of the job you applied for.
If you have the change to pass this test, you get the interview. Every time I got this opportunity I spoke with unprofessional people. I don’t know why, but they are always in a hurry, are non-punctual and very unprofessional in terms of behavior. Their questions are not focused at all on the job and their time to interview you is always very short. How can someone could in 20 minutes time to do understand if you are the right one for the job?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied on their website and soon got an email from an individual in HR. I then had a phone call with the individual about my background and why I wanted to intern there. A few weeks later I received an email from the individual in HR that I should set up a time to speak with another individual in Resource Development. I had a phone call with them and then received an offer email a few days later.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Save the Children?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick. I spoke with HR and the hiring manager on the phone and then I had a three hour interview in person with team members.
Interview Questions: why do you want this job?

title: IT Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children (Sanaa) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was ok, I don't remember any questions but they asked general stuff, most of the questions weren't about my position, random questions that do not help to assess the candidate.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Save the Children (Abuja Nigeria) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was objective and pleasant. There was a mix of simple and difficult questions and a 3-person panel. I enjoyed the interview, but one of the interviewers walked out of the interview while it was still going on, without explaining why he did so and without excusing himself. I felt a bit hurt and thought it was because of his dislike of me.
Interview Questions: How much salary would you want to earn?

title: Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Save the Children (Denver, CO) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Extremely Easy. I knew I had the job within 5 min. Talked for 30 min. Very nice hiring manager. They are looking for outgoing type people for canvassing. (I wasn't exactly sure what I was in for going in)
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. We mainly talked about what it means to canvass

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (London, England) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: lengthy process for an administrator role, with multiple interview rounds. 2 at most would have been sufficient for the level of this role . I did a phone screening, a panel interview a test and another panel interview.
Interview Questions: how do you manage competing priorities

title: Supporter Care Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview, took around 15-20 minutes. Applied through an agency and while I was initially turned down after interview another position opened up shortly after and I was given an offer without a second interview.
Interview Questions: How do you cope with pressure?

title: Digital Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (London, England) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took place over two stages, with questions and an exercise at the first stage and both a presentation and questions at the second. There was a panel of two at stage one, and a panel of three at the second stage. Questions ranged from generic 'Why StC' to more targeted questions around the role and requirements, as you'd expect.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Save the Children?

title: Area Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (Rangoon)
Interview Descriptions: Interview information by phone. The first panel interview by panel of hiring managers and the second one by senoir management . The first and the second interviews were 2 weeks apart.The interview language was English even though for local position.
Interview Questions: General questions such as experineces . Behavioural questions and case senerios.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (Washington, DC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: For the first interview, the HR individual almost forgot about the call. Second interview, went fine I followed up with the required documents. I was given a one week turnaround time, when I didn't hear back I was told that they were still finalizing their decision. I emailed again and same answer was given. I never received an answer from HR.
Interview Questions: Questions related to my experience in education.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview walked through my cv and described the role followed by face to face Competency based interview. 4 competency questions from job description supplied followed by opportunity to ask my own questions. Very friendly and put me at my ease. They are new to competency based questions. Overall a positive experience.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you delivered results

title: Director Position Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: The HR Recruiter had a 30 minute conversation with me and flat out said that I was going to be having an interview with the hiring manager. I did my due diligence and spent a ton of time preparing.  She never bothered to return another email or phone call. Completely unprofessional. She showed zero integrity.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions.

title: Finance Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (Telephone, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview with the direct supervisor, one technical specialist and one HR specialist. Questions read by a panel, with interesting, probing questions against what seemed to be a pre-prepared list of questions.
Interview Questions: How my experience qualified my for the position

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (London, England) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was over Skype. My interviewers looked like they were in their pajamas, I acknowledge that's there's a time difference, but still would be respectful to dress appropriately. At one point, one interviewer left room and wandered off to another room, without excusing herself, a little distracting.  Was given 1.5 days notice for the interview.
Interview Questions:
How do you like to be managed?
How would you track a project with lots of stakeholders?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (Washington, DC) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: My interview was essentially not an interview. They just told me about the job and asked very few questions about me.  It seemed like they did not have any other possible applicants for the position, so the essentially needed to sell it to me more than I needed to sell myself.  This should have told me that it was not going to be a great internship....
Interview Questions: Explain so and so on your resume...

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted 1 week after applying. From the email to the meeting, the interviewer seemed to just want to get the interview out of the way. The interviewer seemed preoccupied and disorganized; asked a few questions; and it was over in 10 minutes. I walked out of there feeling they already made their decision. Complete waste of time.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized?

title: Head of A Technical Sector Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Save the Children (London, England) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and had two interviews: a first with two managers on the phone, tgen a tehnical test and eventually got the last round which was a panel face to face interview with two senior managers. After the interview process tge human resources department contacted two of my referees and ran a background check on me to ensure that I can work with children.
Interview Questions: Experience of security incidents in the field

title: Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from the DC office to schedule an interview for two different positions on two different days.  I was interviewed by two people.  It was an interesting interview.
Interview Questions: The question were directly related to the position.  Like, what would you do in this type of situation, or what would your methods or procedure be.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was too long and not very organized for this type of role. HR does screening, and then had a phone interview ,and in person interview was the same thing, with the same person. No additional questions.
Interview Questions: No difficult or unexpected question

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (Nairobi)
Interview Descriptions: Hiring starts by advertisement then after deadline of application takes two weeks for selection, one is then invited for an interview which is basically a written assessment then if successful you are then invited for an interview which is an oral interview where there will be a panel of 3-5 mostly 3 people,a department guy who will be basically your supervisor, a hr guy and one person from the administration department or support service personnel.If you are successful you will be send an email notifying you that your referee are being contacted and they will be sent forms  to fill about your conduct and how well they know you such stuff.Each process takes two weeks,the written interview will be technical questions that will measure how well you are in your are of specialty. The oral interview will consist of the general part of the interview and technical part restrictively. Caution some people have both interviews at the same day depending on the urgency of the position/recruitment so come prepared for any of the two cases.All the best contract for internship is 3 months and will be extended by a month or max 2 months.
Interview Questions: 5 Policies that you would put in place to ensure safeguarding of cash and cash equivalents

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone screen by HR, then brief phone interview with manager (I was not located near offices). They didn't ask very difficult questions, they just wanted me to tell them about myself, and they wanted tell me about the position. The process from the time I applied to the time I got hired took maybe 1.5 months.
Interview Questions: What do you want to get out of this internship?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Save the Children (London, England) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I went in and asked the manager if I could volunteer as part of my DOfE awards. She accepted right away and asked me when I'd like to start and how many times a week would I like to volunteer.
Interview Questions: It was not a proper interview. The manager just asked me which days I'd like to volunteer.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children in Sept 2014
Interview Questions: They asked me what is my expected salary for this position, I said working in NGO has always been my dream and I know it perfectly that NGO is not a place for seeking big fortune. As long as it's reasonable I'm fine with it. Two days later they called me and gave me offer, the salary was satisfying, especially comparing to local NGOs in China.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (Westlands) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: The position is first advertised through the regions website though its also circulated through various advertisers.If you are successful and pass the CV screening process that usually takes 2-3 weeks, you are then invited to an assessment this is basically skills test relevant with the department you are applying for don't panic just remember what you learnt in school and emerging issues in the industry and sector that will take a week to get the feedback and the assessment is usually an hour.If you are successful the next step is the panel interview that has 3-4 people.The department manager or coordinator that will be your line manager, the hr department assistant and the operations department rep usually an assistant or officer,but for me i got the pleasure of being interviewed by the operations director;very friendly let not the title give you chills.During the interview there is the general questions part and the technical part both will last 30-45 minutes then you will be given a chance to ask the panel some questions.For the general part each will ask about 3 questions then the technical part would basically consist of the department and support guess because its more of a departmental review.If you are successful it will take you a week to get the feedback and they usually ask if you will be available in a week.Most probably they will also have asked that during the interview.Bingo you are up n running.
Interview Questions: Internal controls that an organisation like save the children would put to safe guard its cash and bank assets.

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Save the Children
Interview Descriptions: Initial communications were clear via email and phone. The process can be longer as people travel within the company.
Interview Questions: Directly asking about what salary I would want.

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Save the Children (Alexandria, LA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: A panel of interviewers from various departments which consisted of at least 6 members - was not conducted by the HR department.  I questioned the legitimacy of the process - none of the panel members had HR experience nor the educational background to conduct the process.  In addition, the process was intimidating  - 6 members interviewing one individual.  The atmosphere was more like being on trial.  Save the Children's corporate office needs to investigate the Alexandria, Louisiana hiring process.
Interview Questions: My experienced with working with diverse populations specifically lower socioeconomic populations.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Save the Children (Westport, CT) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: First around: phone interview. Talking about your background and availability during tne next few months. Second,onsite: very easy, briefly reviewed your resume and introduced the organization, discussed your the hours.
Interview Questions: How long can you work for us

title: Education Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Save the Children (Ḩawwārah, Amman Governorate) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was very smooth. I got interviewed by the Education Program Manager. They called me in after i submitted my CV to the HR. And a week after the interview I was hired. Now the recruitment process is more demanding than when i was  hired back in 2013.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why you are applying to Save the children Jordan

title: IYC Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Save the Children (Peshāwar) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Apply on the Brights pyre for vacancy. After shortlisting received call for interview. In interview compete competitors with excellent knowledge and skills. After gaining good score and winning the interview competition received Joining and selection call.
Interview Questions: IYCF stand for?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Save the Children (Washington, DC) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: There were two telephone interviews.  The first was an initial screening with the department assistant.  The second was with the hiring manager.  Both were straightforward.  I was asked to describe my relevant experience and how I could contribute to the team.  I prepared by reading relevant Save the Children publications.
Interview Questions: What advice can you offer us for improving our organization?

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions:
The phone interview was set up via e-mail by and HR person how confirmed that she would initiate the call. Questions were general and then relied on the the position description.

The in person (1:1) interview was set up by one of the project team members.  

The 1:1 interview was strange and somewhat unprofessional. The Interviewer was pleasant but seemed unprepared and inexperienced. For example, the interviewer had not previously reviewed my resume and left me in the interview room to get a drink.  There were few questions about my work experience or technical skills. Interviewer asked personal questions and  spoke more if his/her own experience and then basically insulted everyone who didn't work in her specific field.
Interview Questions: Have you spoken to your family about this position?

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Save the Children (Westport, CT) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I sat with the director who would be overseeing my work. She was extremely nice and was super helpful with information. Answered all of my questions first. Didn't get personal about me. Just wanted to make sure I was qualified. She didn't ask many questions but it was for a temp position so she didn't really need to I suppose. Easy.
Interview Questions: My experience in the field

title: Documentation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Save the Children (Islamabad, Islamabad) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews i have gave.
Interview Questions: the question was related to documentation.

title: Documentation Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (Islamabad, Islamabad) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Though not up to the standard as interviewing HR personal are also mostly not up to the standard they just have few typical questions which more or less every person knew and when it come to have typical questions about your skills the manager sitting there then uses the favoritism for the selected list they wanted to hire based upon their caste or cultural background. 
The standard process for interview is not taken into consideration every time.
Interview Questions: what is Child protection , what is the difference between disaster and risk, Classify emergencies and its forms etc etc

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Save the Children (Washington, DC) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied online with application and writing sample. They also asked to perform a background check, and also provided me with the results. Met with Program Coordinator, then Director for final interview. They did read the writing sample and asked about its contents during the interview.
Interview Questions: Asked about research skills.

title: Distribution/Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Save the Children (Rājanpur, Punjab) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions:
What is Distribution procedure?
How to  request the commodities for distribution?
how to manage if any problem occurred at distribution point?
What is SRF?
What is Outlet Report?
Interview Questions: what will your first action if quarrel occurred in the community?

title: Shop Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Save the Children (Cheam, England) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phoning the branch to have an initial chat with acting shop manager, discussing motives, availability etc. Then being called in for an informal interview/chat in person to assess your suitability for the role and also to be shown around the shop. Was a really straightforward process and once we'd discussed what days I was available I was ready to start the next week! At that time I was under the legal age for operating a till so this was one of the things we discussed - alternatives and how I could get involved e.g. with sorting donations in the back room.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Save The Children?

title: Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children (New Delhi) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: First round of Telephonic Interview, if get shortlisted you would be called in for a 1:1 Interview round. Final round of Interview would be conducted to finalize the salary part. After all the discussions you would be asked to submit your previous employment documents and references if all is clear you will be contact to confirm the Date Of Joining.
Interview Questions: Reason for a change ?

title: Foold Security and Livelihoods Community Mobilization Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Save the Children (Islamabad, Islamabad) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Save the Children conducted test to short list the candidates for interviews. After that shortlisted candidates were called for interviews. A panel of six persons including HR, Program, Child Protection conducted interviews.
Interview Questions: When the child rights ordnance passed in Pakistan

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Save the Children (Washington, DC) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: After first being contacted for an interview, and finally going in for an interview, the hiring manager never contacted me to let me know that they had chosen another candidate. Save the Children is a very reputable organization, however this was not a good example of professionalism from one of their employees.
Interview Questions: How do you thrive in a fast-paced, ever changing environment?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Save the Children in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview followed by a one on one. It was very competitive and I think most candidates were hugely overqualified for the position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Desktop Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Save the Children in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a brief interview with H.R. for screening purposes.  The second interview was a few days later with the IT manager and a couple folks from the team.  I was asked the usual desktop support questions and it went very well.  I was invited back for a third interview witht the IT director a few days after that.  This interview consisted more of the "where do you see yourself in 5 years" type questions.  This also went very well.  Here is my gripe... I was never notified.  I waited two weeks or so and finally emailed the IT manager.  He replied that they found someone that better fit the position.  OK, great, but don't leave people hanging like that.  Very annoying because it's not easy getting to these interviews (mid day mind you so I have to take time from work) and they don't have the courtesy to call or even email you?  After 3 interviews?
Interview Questions: Provide an example where you were not able to solve a problem and what did you do about it?
